email.subject: Call for Papers: International Conference on Software Engineering (ICSE) 2026 Research Track

call_for_papers.description: The ICSE is the premier forum for presenting and discussing recent technical research contributions in Software Engineering. We invite high-quality submissions describing original and unpublished results of software engineering research.

important.details: Starting 2026, all articles published by ACM will be Open Access.
Submissions must follow the latest 'IEEE Submission and Peer Review Policy' and 'ACM Policy on Authorship'.
Registering a paper with a title and an abstract is encouraged but not mandatory.

resubmissions_policy.reject_policy: Papers that receive a REJECT decision in the first cycle are discouraged from resubmitting.
resubmissions_policy.exception_case: Authors can resubmit with a clarifications document.

submission_process.page_limit: 10 pages for the main text, with 2 additional pages for references.

open_science_policy.guiding_principle: All research results should be accessible to the public.

call_for_papers.withdrawing_policy: Authors can withdraw their paper anytime until the final decision.

conclusion.note: At least one author must register for ICSE 2026 and present the paper if accepted.
